<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage54"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Additionally, on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	December 15, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, Vectren Capital issued Guaranteed Senior Notes in a private placement to various institutional investors in the following tranches: (i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$75 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	3.33 percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;Guaranteed Senior Notes, Series A, due
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	December 15, 2022
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and (ii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$75 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	3.90 percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;Guaranteed Senior Notes, Series B, due
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	December 15, 2030
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	. The notes are guaranteed by Vectren Corporation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	A portion of the proceeds received from these issuances were used to finance the following retirements of debt: (i) $75 million of 5.45% Utility Holdings senior unsecured notes that matured on December 1, 2015, (ii) $75 million of 5.31% Vectren Capital senior unsecured notes that matured on December 15, 2015, and (iii) $5 and $10 million of 6.69% Indiana Gas senior unsecured notes that matured on December 21, and 29, 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Vectren Capital Unsecured Note Retirement
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	On March 11, 2014, a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$30 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;Vectren Capital senior unsecured note matured. The Series A note, which was part of a private placement Note Purchase Agreement entered into on March&#160;11, 2009, carried a fixed interest rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	6.37 percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	. The repayment of debt was funded from the Company's short-term credit facility.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	SIGECO Debt Refund and Issuance
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	On
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	September 24, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, SIGECO issued two new series of tax-exempt debt totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$63.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.&#160; Proceeds from the issuance were used to retire three series of tax-exempt bonds aggregating
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$63.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;at a redemption price of par plus accrued interest.&#160; The principal terms of the two new series of tax-exempt debt are:&#160;(i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$22.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;sold in a public offering and bear interest at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	4.00 percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;per annum, due September 1, 2044 and (ii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$41.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, due July&#160;1, 2025, sold in a private placement at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	variable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;rates through September 2019.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Sale of Vectren Fuels Proceeds
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	On August 29, 2014, the Company closed on a transaction to sell its wholly owned coal mining subsidiary, Vectren Fuels, to Sunrise Coal. The proceeds received, net of transaction costs and estimated tax payments, totaled $285 million and were used to retire
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$200 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in outstanding Vectren Capital bank term loans and pay down outstanding short-term debt.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Mandatory Tenders
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, certain series of SIGECO bonds, aggregating
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$87.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, currently bear interest at fixed rates, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$49.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;is subject to mandatory tender in September 2017 and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$38.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;is subject to mandatory tender in September 2020.&#160; Additionally, SIGECO Bond Series 2014B, in the amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$41.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, with a variable interest rate that is reset monthly, is subject to mandatory tender in September 2019.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Investing Cash Flow
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Cash flow required for investing activities was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$509.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$469.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$165.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.&#160;&#160;The primary use of cash in all periods presented reflect utility and nonutility capital expenditures. Capital expenditures increased in 2016 as compared to 2015 by $65.1 million, and also increased in 2015 as compared to 2014 by $28.6 million.&#160;The increase in capital expenditures is attributable to greater expenditures for gas infrastructure improvement projects and environmental compliance. Cash flow required for investing activities in 2014 reflects the receipt of $311 million in proceeds from the sale of Vectren Fuels and reflects the acquisition of the federal business unit from Chevron Energy Solutions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	54
</FONT>
</DIV>

	&#8226;

</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Volatile oil prices and the potential impact on customer consumption and price of other fuel commodities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Direct or indirect effects on the Company&#8217;s business, financial condition, liquidity and results of operations resulting from changes in credit ratings, changes in interest rates, and/or changes in market perceptions of the utility industry and other energy-related industries.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	55
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage56"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	The performance of projects undertaken by the Company&#8217;s nonutility businesses and the success of efforts to realize value from, invest in and develop new opportunities, including but not limited to, the Company&#8217;s Infrastructure Services, Energy Services, and remaining ProLiance Holdings assets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Factors affecting Infrastructure Services, including the level of success in bidding contracts; fluctuations in volume and mix of contracted work; mix of projects received under blanket contracts; unanticipated cost increases in completion of the contracted work; funding requirements associated with multiemployer pension and benefit plans; changes in legislation and regulations impacting the industries in which the customers served operate; the effects of weather; failure to properly estimate the cost to construct projects; the ability to attract and retain qualified employees in a fast growing market where skills are critical; cancellation and/or reductions in the scope of projects by customers; credit worthiness of customers; ability to obtain materials and equipment required to perform services; and changing market conditions, including changes in the market prices of oil and natural gas that would affect the demand for infrastructure construction.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Factors affecting Energy Services, including unanticipated cost increases in completion of the contracted work; changes in legislation and regulations impacting the industries in which the customers served operate; changes in economic influences impacting customers served; failure to properly estimate the cost to construct projects; risks associated with projects owned or operated; failure to appropriately design, construct, or operate projects
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#32;the ability to attract and retain qualified employees; cancellation and/or reductions in the scope of projects by customers; changes in the timing of being awarded projects;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	credit worthiness of customers; lower energy prices negatively impacting the economics of performance contracting business; and changing market conditions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	&#8226;

	Employee or contractor workforce factors including changes in key executives, collective bargaining agreements with union employees, aging workforce issues, work stoppages, or pandemic illness.
</FONT>

</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

</A>
</DIV>
<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM 7A.&#160;&#160;QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET RISK
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company is exposed to various business risks associated with commodity prices, interest rates, and counter-party credit.&#160;&#160;These financial exposures are monitored and managed by the Company as an integral part of its overall risk management program.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s risk management program includes, among other things, the occasional use of derivatives.&#160;&#160;The Company will, from time to time, execute derivative contracts in the normal course of operations while buying and selling commodities and when managing interest rate risk.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company has a risk management committee that consists of senior management as well as financial and operational management.&#160;&#160;The committee is actively involved in identifying risks as well as reviewing and authorizing risk mitigation strategies.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Commodity Price Risk
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Regulated Operations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company&#8217;s regulated operations have limited exposure to commodity price risk for transactions involving purchases and sales of natural gas, coal and purchased power for the benefit of retail customers due to current state regulations, which subject to compliance with those regulations, allow for recovery of the cost of such purchases through natural gas and fuel cost adjustment mechanisms.&#160;&#160;Constructive regulatory orders, such as those authorizing lost margin recovery, other innovative rate designs, and recovery of unaccounted for gas and other gas related expenses, also mitigate the effect gas costs may have on
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	56
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage57"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	the Company&#8217;s financial condition.&#160;&#160;Although the Company&#8217;s regulated operations are exposed to limited commodity price risk, natural gas and coal prices have other effects on working capital requirements, interest costs, and some level of price-sensitivity in volumes sold or delivered.&#160; Indiana Gas and SIGECO hedge up to 50 percent of annual natural gas purchases for each Company utilizing &#160;a variety of terms for&#160;physical fixed-price purchases up to 10 years in duration. Indiana Gas also utilizes financial products, including call options.&#160; Such option contracts are generally short-term in nature and are insignificant in terms of value and volume at December 31, 2016 and 2015.&#160; However, it is possible that the utilization of these instruments may grow in the future.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Wholesale Power Marketing
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company&#8217;s wholesale power marketing activities undertake strategies to optimize electric generating capacity beyond that needed for native load.&#160;&#160;In recent years, the primary strategy involves the sale of generation into the MISO Day Ahead and Real-time markets.&#160;&#160;The Company accounts for any energy contracts that are derivatives at fair value with the offset marked to market through earnings.&#160;&#160;No derivative positions were outstanding on December 31, 2016 and 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	For retail sales of electricity, the Company receives the majority of its NOx and SO
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<SUB STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:7PT">
	2
</SUB>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;allowances at zero cost through an allocation process.&#160;&#160;Based on arrangements with regulators, wholesale operations can purchase allowances from retail operations at current market values, the value of which is distributed back to retail customers through a MISO cost recovery tracking mechanism.&#160;&#160;Wholesale operations are therefore at risk for the cost of allowances, which for the recent past have been volatile.&#160;&#160;The Company manages this risk by purchasing allowances from retail operations as needed and occasionally from other third parties in advance of usage.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Other Operations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Other commodity-related operations are exposed to commodity price risk associated with gasoline/diesel through third party suppliers. Occasionally, the Company will hedge a portion of such requirements using financial instruments and using physically settled forward purchase contracts. However, during the years presented, such utilization has not been significant.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Interest Rate Risk
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company is exposed to interest rate risk associated with its borrowing arrangements.&#160;&#160;Its risk management program seeks to reduce the potentially adverse effects that market volatility may have on interest expense.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2016, debt subject to interest rate volatility was approximately 12 percent. To further manage this exposure, the Company may also use derivative financial instruments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Market risk is estimated as the potential impact resulting from fluctuations in interest rates on adjustable rate borrowing arrangements exposed to short-term interest rate volatility.&#160;&#160;During
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, the weighted average combined borrowings under these arrangements approximated $101 million and $120 million, respectively.&#160;&#160;At December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, combined borrowings under these arrangements were $236 million. As of December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;combined borrowings under these arrangements were $56 million. Based upon average borrowing rates under these facilities during the years ended December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, an increase of 100 basis points (one percentage point) in the rates would have increased interest expense by approximately $1.0 million in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and $1.2 million in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Other Risks
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	By using financial instruments and physically settled fixed price forward contracts to manage risk, the Company creates exposure to counter-party credit risk and market risk.&#160;&#160;The Company manages exposure to counter-party credit risk by entering into contracts with companies that can be reasonably expected to fully perform under the terms of the contract.&#160;&#160;Counter-party credit risk is monitored regularly and positions are adjusted appropriately to manage risk.&#160;&#160;Further, tools such as netting arrangements and requests for collateral are also used to manage credit risk.&#160;&#160;Market risk is the adverse effect on the value of a financial instrument that results from a change in commodity prices or interest rates.&#160;&#160;The Company attempts to manage exposure to market risk associated with commodity contracts and interest rates by establishing parameters and monitoring those parameters that limit the types and degree of market risk that may be undertaken.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	57
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage58"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company&#8217;s customer receivables associated with utility operations are primarily derived from residential, commercial, and industrial customers located in Indiana and west central Ohio.&#160;&#160;However, some exposure from nonutility operations extends throughout the United States.&#160;&#160;The Company manages credit risk associated with its receivables by continually reviewing creditworthiness and requests cash deposits or refunds cash deposits based on that review.&#160;&#160;Credit risk associated with certain investments is also managed by a review of creditworthiness and receipt of collateral.&#160;&#160;In addition, credit risk for the Company's utilities is mitigated by regulatory orders that allow recovery of all uncollectible accounts expense in Ohio and the gas cost portion of uncollectible accounts expense in Indiana based on historical experience.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	58
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

</EFX_MARKET_RISK>

<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;

<EFX_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM 8.&#160;&#160;FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SUPPLEMENTARY DATA
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="VVC10K2016DOC_HTM_SCBA5CA887F153245152AB1B091827861">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	MANAGEMENT&#8217;S RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Vectren Corporation&#8217;s management is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting.&#160;&#160;Those control procedures underlie the preparation of the consolidated balance sheets, statements of income, comprehensive income, cash flows, and common shareholders&#8217; equity, and related footnotes contained herein.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	These consolidated financial statements were prepared in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States and follow accounting policies and principles applicable to regulated public utilities.&#160;&#160;The integrity and objectivity of these consolidated financial statements, including required estimates and judgments, is the responsibility of management.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	These consolidated financial statements are also subject to an evaluation of internal control over financial reporting conducted under the supervision and with the participation of management, including the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer.&#160;&#160;Based on that evaluation, conducted under the framework in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Internal Control &#8212; Integrated Framework (2013)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission, the Company concluded that its internal control over financial reporting was effective as of December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.&#160;&#160;Management certified this in its Sarbanes Oxley Section 302 certifications, which are filed as exhibits to this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;Form 10-K.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	59
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage60"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	REPORT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	To the Board of Directors and Shareholders of Vectren Corporation:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of Vectren Corporation and subsidiaries (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) as of December 31, 2016 and 2015, and the related consolidated statements of income, comprehensive income, shareholders&#8217; equity and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2016. Our audits also included the financial statement schedule listed in the Index at Item 15. These financial statements and financial statement schedule are the responsibility of the Company&#8217;s management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the financial statements and financial statement schedule based on our audits.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In our opinion, such consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of Vectren Corporation and subsidiaries as of December 31, 2016 and 2015, and the results of their operations and their cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2016, in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America. Also, in our opinion, such financial statement schedule, when considered in relation to the basic consolidated financial statements taken as a whole, presents fairly, in all material respects, the information set forth therein.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	We have also audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016, based on the criteria established in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Internal Control &#8212; Integrated Framework (2013)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission and our report dated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	February&#160;23, 2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;expressed an unqualified opinion on the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	/s/ DELOITTE &amp; TOUCHE LLP
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Indianapolis, Indiana
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	February&#160;23, 2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	REPORT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	To the Board of Directors and Shareholders of Vectren Corporation:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	We have audited the internal control over financial reporting of Vectren Corporation and subsidiaries (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) as of December 31, 2016, based on criteria established in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Internal Control &#8212; Integrated Framework (2013)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission. The Company&#8217;s management is responsible for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting and for its assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting included in the accompanying Management&#8217;s Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting based on our audit.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	We conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects. Our audit included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material weakness exists, testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk, and performing such other procedures as we considered necessary in the circumstances. We believe that our audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	A company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting is a process designed by, or under the supervision of, the company&#8217;s principal executive and principal financial officers, or persons performing similar functions, and effected by the company&#8217;s board of directors, management, and other personnel to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. A company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that (1) pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the company; (2) provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (3) provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the company&#8217;s assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Because of the inherent limitations of internal control over financial reporting, including the possibility of collusion or improper management override of controls, material misstatements due to error or fraud may not be prevented or detected on a timely basis. Also, projections of any evaluation of the effectiveness of the internal control over financial reporting to future periods are subject to the risk that the controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In our opinion, the Company maintained, in all material respects, effective internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016, based on the criteria established in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Internal Control &#8212; Integrated Framework (2013)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	We have also audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the consolidated financial statements and financial statement schedule as of and for the year ended December 31, 2016 of the Company and our report dated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	February&#160;23, 2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;expressed an unqualified opinion on those financial statements and financial statement schedule.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	/s/ DELOITTE &amp; TOUCHE LLP
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Indianapolis, Indiana
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	February&#160;23, 2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	61
</FONT>

	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;

<A NAME="FIS_BALANCE_SHEET"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

	VECTREN CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

	CONSOLIDATED BALANCE SHEETS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_19"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;VECTREN CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS OF COMPREHENSIVE INCOME
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(In millions)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	The accompanying notes are an integral part of these consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
