<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	VECTREN CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</FONT>
</DIV>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="VVC10K2016DOC_HTM_S0D3752BCBCE726427588B1B06E8AF387">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	1. Organization and Nature of Operations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Vectren Corporation (the Company or Vectren), an Indiana corporation, is an energy holding company headquartered in Evansville, Indiana.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s wholly owned subsidiary, Vectren Utility Holdings, Inc. (Utility Holdings or VUHI), serves as the intermediate holding company for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;public utilities:&#160;&#160;Indiana Gas Company, Inc. (Indiana Gas or Vectren Energy Delivery of Indiana - North), Southern Indiana Gas and Electric Company (SIGECO or Vectren Energy Delivery of Indiana - South), and Vectren Energy Delivery of Ohio, Inc. (VEDO).&#160;&#160;Utility Holdings also has other assets that provide information technology and other services to the three utilities.&#160;&#160;Utility Holdings&#8217; consolidated operations are collectively referred to as the Utility Group.&#160;&#160;Both Vectren and Utility Holdings are holding companies as defined by the Energy Policy Act of 2005.&#160;&#160;Vectren was incorporated under the laws of Indiana on June 10, 1999.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Indiana Gas provides energy delivery services to approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	587,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;natural gas customers located in central and southern Indiana.&#160;&#160;SIGECO provides energy delivery services to approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	144,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;electric customers and approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	111,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;gas customers located near Evansville in southwestern Indiana.&#160;&#160;SIGECO also owns and operates electric generation assets to serve its electric customers and optimizes those assets in the wholesale power market.&#160;&#160;Indiana Gas and SIGECO generally do business as Vectren Energy Delivery of Indiana.&#160;&#160;VEDO provides energy delivery services to approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	316,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;natural gas customers located near Dayton in west central Ohio.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company, through Vectren Enterprises, Inc. (Enterprises), is involved in nonutility activities in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;primary business areas:&#160;&#160;Infrastructure Services and Energy Services.&#160;Infrastructure Services provides underground pipeline construction and repair services.&#160;&#160;Energy Services provides energy performance contracting and sustainable infrastructure, such as renewables, distributed generation, and combined heat and power projects. Prior to August 29, 2014, the Company had activities in a coal mining business. Results in the financial statements include the results of Vectren Fuels, Inc. (Vectren Fuels) through the date of sale of August 29, 2014, when the Company exited the coal mining business. Enterprises also has other legacy businesses that have investments in energy-related opportunities and services and other investments.&#160;All of the above is collectively referred to as the Nonutility Group.&#160;&#160;Enterprises supports the Company's regulated utilities by providing infrastructure services.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="VVC10K2016DOC_HTM_S22D4C3EA9171C1F1386AB1B06E8C7E05">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In applying its accounting policies, the Company makes judgments, assumptions, and estimates that affect the amounts reported in these consolidated financial statements and related footnotes.&#160;&#160;Examples of transactions for which estimation techniques are used include valuing pension and postretirement benefit obligations, deferred tax obligations, unbilled revenue, uncollectible accounts, regulatory assets and liabilities, asset retirement obligations, and derivatives and other financial instruments.&#160;&#160;Estimates also impact the depreciation of utility and nonutility plant and the testing of goodwill and other assets for impairment.&#160;&#160;Recorded estimates are revised when better information becomes available or when actual amounts can be determined.&#160;&#160;Actual results could differ from current estimates.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Principles of Consolidation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The consolidated financial statements include the accounts of the Company and its wholly owned subsidiaries, after appropriate elimination of intercompany transactions. The Infrastructure Services segment, through wholly owned subsidiaries Miller Pipeline, LLC and Minnesota Limited, LLC, provides underground pipeline construction and repair services for customers that include Vectren Utility Holdings' utilities. In accordance with consolidation guidance under ASC 980, fees incurred by Vectren Utility Holdings and its subsidiaries for these pipeline construction and repair services, are appropriately not eliminated in consolidation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	68
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Subsequent Events Review
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Management performs a review of subsequent events for any events occurring after the balance sheet date but prior to the date the financial statements are issued.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Cash &amp; Cash Equivalents
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Highly liquid investments with an original maturity of three months or less at the date of purchase are considered cash equivalents.&#160;&#160;Cash and cash equivalents are stated at cost plus accrued interest to approximate fair value.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Allowance for Uncollectible Accounts
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company maintains allowances for uncollectible accounts for estimated losses resulting from the inability of its customers to make required payments. The Company estimates the allowance for uncollectible accounts based on a variety of factors including the length of time receivables are past due, the financial health of its customers, unusual macroeconomic conditions, and historical experience.&#160;&#160;If the financial condition of its customers deteriorates or other circumstances occur that result in an impairment of customers&#8217; ability to make payments, the Company records additional allowances as needed.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Inventories
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In most circumstances, the Company&#8217;s inventory components are recorded using an average cost method; however, natural gas in storage at the Company&#8217;s Indiana utilities are recorded using the Last In &#8211; First Out (LIFO) method.&#160;&#160;Inventory related to the Company&#8217;s regulated operations is valued at historical cost consistent with ratemaking treatment.&#160;&#160;Materials and supplies are recorded as inventory when purchased and subsequently charged to expense or capitalized to plant when installed.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Property, Plant &amp; Equipment
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Both the Company&#8217;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Utility Plant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Nonutility Plant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;is stated at historical cost, inclusive of financing costs and direct and indirect construction costs, less accumulated depreciation and when necessary, impairment charges.&#160;&#160;The cost of renewals and betterments that extend the useful life are capitalized.&#160;&#160;Maintenance and repairs, including the cost of removal of minor items of property and planned major maintenance projects, are charged to expense as incurred.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Utility Plant &amp; Related Depreciation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Both the IURC and PUCO allow the Company&#8217;s utilities to capitalize financing costs associated with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Utility Plant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;based on a computed interest cost and a designated cost of equity funds.&#160;&#160;These financing costs are commonly referred to as AFUDC and are capitalized for ratemaking purposes and for financial reporting purposes instead of amounts that would otherwise be capitalized when acquiring nonutility plant.&#160;&#160;The Company reports both the debt and equity components of AFUDC in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Other &#8211; net
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Consolidated Statements of Income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	When property that represents a retirement unit is replaced or removed, the remaining historical value of such property is charged to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Utility Plant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, with an offsetting charge to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Accumulated depreciation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, resulting in no gain or loss.&#160;&#160;Costs to dismantle and remove retired property are recovered through the depreciation rates as determined by the IURC and PUCO.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company&#8217;s portion of jointly owned
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Utility Plant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, along with that plant&#8217;s related operating expenses, is presented in these financial statements in proportion to the ownership percentage.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Nonutility Plant &amp; Related Depreciation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The depreciation of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Nonutility Plant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;is charged against income over its estimated useful life, using the straight-line method of depreciation.&#160;&#160;When nonutility property is retired, or otherwise disposed of, the asset and accumulated depreciation are removed, and the resulting gain or loss is reflected in income, typically impacting operating expenses.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Impairment Reviews
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Property, plant and equipment along with other long-lived assets are reviewed as facts and circumstances indicate that the carrying amount may be impaired.&#160; This impairment review involves the comparison of an asset&#8217;s (or group of assets&#8217;) carrying value to the estimated future cash flows the asset (or asset group) is expected to generate over a remaining life.&#160; If this evaluation were to conclude that the carrying value is impaired, an impairment charge would be recorded based on the difference between the carrying amount and its fair value (less costs to sell for assets to be disposed of by sale) as a charge to operations or discontinued operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	69
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage70"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Investments in Unconsolidated Affiliates
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investments in unconsolidated affiliates
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;where the Company has significant influence are accounted for using the equity method of accounting.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s share of net income or loss from these investments is recorded in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Equity in earnings (losses) of unconsolidated affiliates
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.&#160;&#160;Dividends are recorded as a reduction of the carrying value of the investment when received.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Investments in unconsolidated affiliates
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;where the Company does not have significant influence are accounted for using the cost method of accounting.&#160;&#160;Dividends associated with cost method investments are recorded as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Other income &#8211; net
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;when received.&#160;&#160;Investments are reviewed as facts and circumstances indicate that the carrying amount may be impaired.&#160; This impairment review involves the comparison of an investment's fair value to its carrying value. Investments, when necessary, include adjustments for declines in value judged to be other than temporary.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Goodwill
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Goodwill
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;recorded on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;results from business acquisitions and is based on a fair value allocation of the businesses&#8217; purchase price at the time of acquisition.&#160;&#160;Goodwill is charged to expense only when it is impaired.&#160;&#160;The Company tests its goodwill for impairment at an operating segment level because the components within the segments are similar.&#160;&#160;These tests are performed at least annually and at the beginning of each year.&#160;&#160;Impairment reviews consist of a comparison of fair value to the carrying amount.&#160;&#160;If the fair value is less than the carrying amount, an impairment loss is recognized in operations.&#160;&#160;No goodwill impairments have been recorded during the periods presented.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Regulation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Retail public utility operations affecting Indiana customers are subject to regulation by the IURC, and retail public utility operations affecting Ohio customers are subject to regulation by the PUCO.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s accounting policies give recognition to the ratemaking and accounting practices authorized by these agencies.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Refundable or Recoverable Gas Costs &amp; Cost of Fuel &amp; Purchased Power
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	All metered gas rates in Indiana contain a gas cost adjustment clause that allows the Company to charge for changes in the cost of purchased gas.&#160;&#160;Metered electric rates contain a fuel adjustment clause that allows for adjustment in charges for electric energy to reflect changes in the cost of fuel.&#160;&#160;The net energy cost of purchased power, subject to a variable benchmark based on NYMEX natural gas prices, is also recovered through regulatory proceedings.&#160;&#160;The Company records any under-or-over-recovery resulting from gas and fuel adjustment clauses each month in revenues.&#160;&#160;A corresponding asset or liability is recorded until the under-or-over-recovery is billed or refunded to utility customers.&#160;&#160;The cost of gas sold is charged to operating expense as delivered to customers, and the cost of fuel and purchased power for electric generation is charged to operating expense when consumed.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Regulatory Assets &amp; Liabilities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Regulatory assets represent certain incurred costs, which will result in probable future cash recoveries from customers through the ratemaking process.&#160;&#160;Regulatory liabilities represent probable expenditures by the Company for removal costs or future reductions in revenues associated with amounts that are to be credited to customers through the ratemaking process.&#160;&#160;The Company continually assesses the recoverability of costs recognized as regulatory assets and liabilities and the ability to recognize new regulatory assets and liabilities associated with its regulated utility operations.&#160;&#160;Given the current regulatory environment in its jurisdictions, the Company believes such accounting is appropriate.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company collects an estimated cost of removal of its utility plant through depreciation rates established in regulatory proceedings.&#160;&#160;The Company records amounts expensed in advance of payments as a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Regulatory liability
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;because the liability does not meet the threshold of an asset retirement obligation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Postretirement Obligations &amp; Costs
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company recognizes the funded status of its pension plans and postretirement plans on its balance sheet.&#160;&#160;The funded status of a defined benefit plan is its assets (if any) less its projected benefit obligation (PBO), which reflects service accrued to date and includes the impact of projected salary increases (for pay-related benefits).&#160;&#160;The funded status of a postretirement plan is its assets (if any) less its accumulated postretirement benefit obligation (APBO), which reflects accrued service to date.&#160;&#160;To the extent this obligation exceeds amounts previously recognized in the statement of income, the Company records a
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	70
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage71"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Regulatory asset
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for that portion related to its rate regulated utilities.&#160;&#160;To the extent that excess liability does not relate to a rate regulated utility, the offset is recorded as a reduction to equity in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Accumulated other comprehensive income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The annual cost of all postretirement plans is recognized in operating expenses or capitalized to plant following the direct labor of current employees.&#160;&#160;Specific to pension plans, the Company uses the projected unit credit actuarial cost method to calculate service cost and the PBO.&#160;&#160;This method projects the present value of benefits at retirement and allocates that cost over the projected years of service.&#160;&#160;Annual service cost represents one year&#8217;s benefit accrual while the PBO represents benefits allocated to previously accrued service.&#160;&#160;For other postretirement plans, service cost is calculated by dividing the present value of a participant&#8217;s projected postretirement benefits into equal parts based upon the number of years between a participant&#8217;s hire date and first eligible retirement date.&#160;&#160;Annual service cost represents one year&#8217;s benefit accrual while the APBO represents benefit allocated to previously accrued service.&#160;&#160;To calculate the expected return on pension plan assets, the Company uses the plan assets&#8217; market-related value and an expected long-term rate of return.&#160;&#160;For the majority of the Company&#8217;s pension plans, the fair market value of the assets at the balance sheet date is adjusted to a market-related value by recognizing the change in fair value experienced in a given year ratably over a five-year period.&#160;&#160;Interest cost represents the annual accretion of the PBO and APBO at the discount rate.&#160;&#160;Actuarial gains and losses outside of a corridor (equal to 10 percent of the greater of the benefit obligation and the market-related value of assets) are amortized over the expected future working lifetime of active participants (except for plans where almost all participants are inactive).&#160;&#160;Prior service costs related to plan changes are amortized over the expected future working lifetime (or to full eligibility date for postretirement plan other than pensions) of the active participants at the time of the amendment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Asset Retirement Obligations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	A portion of removal costs related to interim retirements of gas utility pipeline and utility poles, certain asbestos-related issues, and reclamation activities meet the definition of an asset retirement obligation (ARO).&#160;&#160;The Company records the fair value of a liability for a legal ARO in the period in which it is incurred.&#160;&#160;When the liability is initially recorded, the Company capitalizes a cost by increasing the carrying amount of the related long-lived asset.&#160;&#160;The liability is accreted, and the capitalized cost is depreciated over the useful life of the related asset.&#160;&#160;Upon settlement of the liability, the Company settles the obligation for its recorded amount or incurs a gain or loss.&#160;&#160;To the extent regulation is involved, regulatory assets and liabilities result when accretion and amortization is adjusted to match rates established by regulators and any gain or loss is subject to deferral.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Product Warranties, Performance Guarantees &amp; Other Guarantees
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Liabilities and expenses associated with product warranties and performance guarantees are recognized based on historical experience at the time the associated revenue is recognized.&#160;&#160;Adjustments are made as changes become reasonably estimable.&#160;&#160;The Company does not recognize the fair value of an obligation at inception for these guarantees because they are guarantees of the Company&#8217;s own performance and/or product installations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	While not significant for the periods presented, the Company does recognize the fair value of an obligation at the inception of a guarantee in certain circumstances.&#160;&#160;These circumstances would include executing certain indemnification agreements and guaranteeing operating lease residual values, the performance of a third party, or the indebtedness of a third party.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Energy Contracts &amp; Derivatives
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company will periodically execute derivative contracts in the normal course of operations while buying and selling commodities to be used in operations, optimizing its generation assets, and managing risk.&#160;&#160;A derivative is recognized on the balance sheet as an asset or liability measured at its fair market value and the change in the derivative's fair market value is recognized currently in earnings unless specific hedge criteria are met.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	When an energy contract that is a derivative is designated and documented as a normal purchase or normal sale (NPNS), it is exempt from mark-to-market accounting.&#160;&#160;Most energy contracts executed by the Company are subject to the NPNS exclusion or are not considered derivatives.&#160;&#160;Such energy contracts include Real Time and Day Ahead purchase and sale contracts with the MISO, natural gas purchases, and wind farm and other electric generating contracts.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	When the Company engages in energy contracts and financial contracts that are derivatives and are not subject to the NPNS or other exclusions, such contracts are recorded at market value as current or noncurrent assets or liabilities depending on their value and when the contracts are expected to be settled.&#160;&#160;Contracts and any associated collateral with counter-parties subject to
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	71
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage72"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	master netting arrangements are presented net in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.&#160;&#160;The offset resulting from carrying the derivative at fair value on the balance sheet is charged to earnings unless it qualifies as a hedge or is subject to regulatory accounting treatment.&#160;&#160;When hedge accounting is appropriate, the Company assesses and documents hedging relationships between the derivative contract and underlying risks as well as its risk management objectives and anticipated effectiveness.&#160;&#160;When the hedging relationship is highly effective, derivatives are designated as hedges.&#160;&#160;The market value of the effective portion of the hedge is marked to market in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Accumulated other comprehensive income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for cash flow hedges.&#160;Ineffective portions of hedging arrangements are marked to market through earnings.&#160;&#160;For fair value hedges, both the derivative and the underlying hedged item are marked to market through earnings.&#160;&#160;The offset to contracts affected by regulatory accounting treatment are marked to market as a regulatory asset or liability.&#160;&#160;Market value for derivative contracts is determined using quoted market prices from independent sources.&#160;&#160;The Company rarely enters into contracts that have a significant impact to the financial statements where internal models are used to calculate fair value.&#160;&#160;As of and for the periods presented, related derivative activity is not material to these financial statements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Income Taxes
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Deferred income taxes are provided for temporary differences between the tax basis (adjusted for related unrecognized tax benefits, if any) of an asset or liability and its reported amount in the financial statements.&#160; Deferred tax assets and liabilities are computed based on the currently-enacted statutory income tax rates that are expected to be applicable when the temporary differences are scheduled to reverse.&#160; The Company&#8217;s rate regulated utilities recognize regulatory liabilities for deferred taxes provided in excess of the current statutory tax rate and regulatory assets for deferred taxes provided at rates less than the current statutory tax rate.&#160; Such tax-related regulatory assets and liabilities are reported at the revenue requirement level and amortized to income as the related temporary differences reverse, generally over the lives of the related properties.&#160; A valuation allowance is recorded to reduce the carrying amounts of deferred tax assets unless it is more likely than not that the deferred tax assets will be realized.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Tax benefits associated with income tax positions taken, or expected to be taken, in a tax return are recorded only when the more-likely-than-not recognition threshold is satisfied and measured at the largest amount of benefit that is greater than 50 percent likely of being realized upon settlement.&#160; The Company reports interest and penalties associated with unrecognized tax benefits within
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income taxes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Consolidated Statements of Income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and reports tax liabilities related to unrecognized tax benefits as part of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Deferred credits &amp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	other liabilities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Investment tax credits (ITCs) are deferred and amortized to income over the approximate lives of the related property. Production tax credits (PTCs) are recognized as energy is generated and sold based on a per kilowatt hour rate prescribed in applicable federal and state statutes.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Revenues
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Most revenues are recognized as products and services are delivered to customers.&#160;&#160;Some nonutility revenues are recognized using the percentage of completion method.&#160;&#160;The Company records revenues for services and goods delivered but not billed at the end of an accounting period in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Accrued unbilled revenues
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	MISO Transactions
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	With the IURC&#8217;s approval, the Company is a member of the MISO, a FERC approved regional transmission organization. &#160;The MISO serves the electrical transmission needs of much of the Midcontinent region and maintains operational control over the Company&#8217;s electric transmission facilities as well as that of other utilities in the region. &#160;The Company is an active participant in the MISO energy markets, bidding its owned generation into the Day Ahead and Real Time markets and procuring power for its retail customers at Locational Marginal Pricing (LMP) as determined by the MISO market.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	MISO-related purchase and sale transactions are recorded using settlement information provided by the MISO. These purchase and sale transactions are accounted for on a net hourly position.&#160;Net purchases in a single hour are recorded in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Cost of fuel &amp; purchased power
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and net sales in a single hour are recorded in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Electric utility revenues
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	. On occasion, prior period transactions are resettled outside the routine process due to a change in the MISO&#8217;s tariff or a material interpretation thereof.&#160;&#160;Expenses associated with resettlements are recorded once the resettlement is probable and the resettlement amount can be estimated. Revenues associated with resettlements are recognized when the amount is determinable and collectability is reasonably assured.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	72
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage73"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:528PX;FONT-SIZE:16PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:16PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company also receives transmission revenue that results from other members&#8217; use of the Company&#8217;s transmission system.&#160;&#160;These revenues are also included in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Electric utility revenues.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#160;&#160;Generally, these transmission revenues along with costs charged by the MISO are considered components of base rates and any variance from that included in base rates is recovered from / refunded to retail customers through tracking mechanisms.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Share-Based Compensation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company grants share-based awards to certain employees and board members.&#160;&#160;Liability classified share-based compensation awards are re-measured at the end of each period based on an expected settlement date fair value.&#160;&#160;Equity classified share-based compensation awards are measured at the grant date, based on the fair value of the award.&#160;&#160;Expense associated with share-based awards is recognized over the requisite service period, which generally begins on the date the award is granted through the earlier of the date the award vests or the date the employee becomes retirement eligible.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Excise &amp; Utility Receipts Taxes
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Excise taxes and a portion of utility receipts taxes are included in rates charged to customers.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, the Company records these taxes received as a component of operating revenues, which totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$28.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$29.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$32.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.&#160;&#160;Expense associated with excise and utility receipts taxes are recorded as a component of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Taxes other than income taxes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Operating Segments
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company&#8217;s chief operating decision maker is the Chief Executive Officer.&#160;&#160;The Company uses net income calculated in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles as its most relevant performance measure.&#160;&#160;The Company has
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;operating segments within its Utility Group,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;operating segments in its Nonutility Group, and a Corporate and Other segment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Fair Value Measurements
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Certain assets and liabilities are valued and disclosed at fair value.&#160;&#160;Financial assets include securities held in trust by the Company&#8217;s pension plans.&#160;&#160;Nonfinancial assets and liabilities include the initial measurement of an asset retirement obligation or the use of fair value in goodwill, intangible assets, and long-lived assets impairment tests.&#160; FASB guidance provides the framework for measuring fair value.&#160;&#160;That framework provides a fair value hierarchy that prioritizes the inputs to valuation techniques used to measure fair value.&#160;&#160;The hierarchy gives the highest priority to unadjusted quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities (Level 1 measurements) and the lowest priority to unobservable inputs (Level 3 measurements). The three levels of the fair value hierarchy are described as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_20"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:18%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:82%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;BORDER-BOTTOM:2PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;BORDER-LEFT:2PX SOLID #000000;BORDER-TOP:2PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Level 1
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;BORDER-BOTTOM:2PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;BORDER-RIGHT:2PX SOLID #000000;BORDER-TOP:2PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Inputs to the valuation methodology are unadjusted quoted prices for identical assets or liabilities in active markets that the&#160;Company has the ability to access.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;BORDER-BOTTOM:2PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;BORDER-LEFT:2PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Level 2
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;BORDER-BOTTOM:2PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;BORDER-RIGHT:2PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Inputs to the valuation methodology include
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:72PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#183;&#160;quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities in active markets;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:72PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#183;&#160;quoted prices for identical or similar assets or liabilities in inactive markets;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:72PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#183;&#160;inputs other than quoted prices that are observable for the asset or liability;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:72PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#183;&#160;inputs that are derived principally from or corroborated by observable market
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:72PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#160;&#160;data by correlation or other means
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	If the asset or liability has a specified (contractual) term, the Level 2 input must be observable for substantially the full term of the asset or liability.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;BORDER-BOTTOM:2PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;BORDER-LEFT:2PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Level 3
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;BORDER-BOTTOM:2PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;BORDER-RIGHT:2PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Inputs to the valuation methodology are unobservable and significant to the fair value measurement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The asset or liability&#8217;s fair value measurement level within the fair value hierarchy is based on the lowest level of any input that is significant to the fair value measurement.&#160;&#160;Valuation techniques used maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	73
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;

	3. Utility &amp; Nonutility Plant
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	%

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	SIGECO and Alcoa Generating Corporation (AGC), a subsidiary of Alcoa, Inc. (Alcoa), own a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	300
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;MW unit at the Warrick Power Plant (Warrick Unit 4) as tenants in common.&#160;&#160;SIGECO's share of the cost of this unit at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$190.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;with accumulated depreciation totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$110.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.&#160;&#160;AGC and SIGECO share equally in the cost of operation and output of the unit.&#160;&#160;SIGECO's share of operating costs is included in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Other operating
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	expenses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Consolidated Statements of Income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In the first quarter of 2016, Alcoa closed its smelter operations. Historically, on-site generation owned and operated by AGC has been used to provide power to the smelter, as well as other mill operations, which will continue. Generation from Alcoa's share of the Warrick Unit 4 has historically been sold into the MISO market. The Company is actively working with Alcoa on plans related to continued operation of this generation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Nonutility Plant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Nonutility Plant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;is presented net of accumulated depreciation and amortization totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$460.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$420.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, respectively.&#160;&#160;For the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, the Company capitalized interest totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$1.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$0.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, respectively, on nonutility plant construction projects.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In 2016, the estimated depreciable lives for certain pieces of equipment at Minnesota Limited, LLC were reevaluated and extended due to a change in service life of the equipment. As a result of this evaluation, the Company extended the estimated useful life of certain pieces of equipment effective January 1 of the current year. The effect of this change in estimate was a reduction of annual depreciation expense of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$9.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	74
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
